data.description: About InvescoAs one of the world’s leading independent global investment firms, Invesco is dedicated to rethinking possibilities for our clients. By delivering the combined power of our distinctive investment management capabilities, we provide a wide range of investment strategies and vehicles to our clients around the world. If you're looking for challenging work, intelligent colleagues, and exposure across a global footprint, come explore your potential at Invesco.What’s in it for you?Our people are at the very core of our success. Invesco employees get more out of life through our benefit and perk offerings including: Company networking events with other internsPeer Sponsor Program Leadership Connection seriesVirtual Lunch and LearnsInvesco Cares volunteer eventsComplimentary coffee and snacks401(K) matching of 100% up to the first 6% with a discretionary supplemental contribution Job DescriptionDigital Asset Product Summer Internship – Early Careers OverviewReady to make your mark in the world of asset management? Spend an unforgettable summer at Invesco alongside a select group of driven students. Our 10-week Summer Internship Program, kicking off in June 2026, offers you the opportunity to delve into the dynamic world of client services within a global investment firm. You’ll learn from seasoned professionals, gain hands-on experience, and build lasting connections.As part of our Summer Internship Program cohort, you’ll participate in orientation, networking events, development workshops, and volunteer activities. You’ll work side by side with talented teams to learn about the business and contribute to meaningful initiatives.Here’s the best part: crush your internship, and you could be eligible for a full-time offer to join our Early Career Program after graduation!Digital Asset Product Team OverviewOur team drives innovation in digital assets and blockchain integration across product structures, operational processes, and market infrastructure. Acting as a global hub of expertise, we identify opportunities to improve efficiency and expand distribution capabilities. This internship offers hands-on experience in a transformative area of product innovation and exposure to seasoned professionals across digital assets and broader investment disciplines.What you’ll doPresentation & Documentation Support: Prepare presentations, meeting notes, and product documentation to assist the digital assets product team.Idea Contribution: Share insights and suggestions during team meetings to enhance product offerings and improve processes.Competitor Benchmarking: Assist with data collection, validation, and analysis to evaluate competitor strategies and positioning.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with technology, compliance, legal, and marketing teams to understand the practical implications of product development and delivery.Project Variety: Contribute to ad hoc projects and support digital asset product initiatives and launches.What you getCareer Launchpad – Build real-world skills and set the foundation for a future at Invesco—and beyondYour Own Mentor – Get paired with a mentor to guide your experience and support your growthIntern Community – Join a crew of fellow interns to collaborate, share ideas, and get to know—both in and out of the office. Pathway to Future Opportunities – Nail your internship, and you could be eligible for a full-time offer to join our Early Career Program after graduation! Real Work, Real Impact – Tackle meaningful projects and gain insight into client services at a global investment firmMinimum Qualifications Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program and be a rising Junior graduating by the summer of 2027 We welcome diverse academic backgrounds, with preference for:Technology: Computer Science, Information Technology, Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT), AI/Data ScienceBusiness: Finance, EconomicsMinimum GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale Strong interest in digital assets, blockchain technology, and financial marketsExcellent analytical and problem-solving abilitiesProficiency in Excel (e.g., pivot tables, advanced functions) and PowerPointExceptional written and verbal communication skillsStrong organizational abilities, leadership qualities, and interpersonal skillsAbility to thrive in a small, dynamic team environmentHighly self-motivated, proactive, and goal-orientedMust be able to work in one of Invesco’s offices where the program is available Preferred QualificationsInterest in digital assets and blockchain technology; practical experience is a plusBasic knowledge of mutual fund operations and capital marketsFamiliarity with programming languages such as R, Python, or VBA is a plusExperience with data visualization tools like Power BI or TableauUnderstanding of AI applications (e.g., chatbots, predictive analytics)Compensation for this position is $35/hour.Full Time / Part TimeFull timeWorker TypeStudent/Intern (Fixed Term)Job Exempt (Yes / No)NoWorkplace ModelPursuant to Invesco’s Workplace Policy, employees are expected to comply with the firm’s most current workplace model, which as of October 1, 2025, includes spending at least four full days each week working in an Invesco office. This reflects our belief that spending time together in the office helps us build stronger relationships, collaborate more easily, and support each other’s growth and development.The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time.Invesco's culture of inclusivity and its commitment to diversity in the workplace are demonstrated through our people practices. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, or veteran status. Our equal opportunity employment efforts comply with all applicable U.S. state and federal laws governing non-discrimination in employment.
